description: Borrowed from Medieval Latin pūnctuālis (“relating to a point”), from Late Latin pūnctus (“point”) + -ālis (adjective suffix).

adjectives.description: punctual (comparative more punctual, superlative most punctual)

entries.meaning: (of an event) Happening at the appointed time
(of a person) Acting at the appointed time
examples: Luis is never late; he's the most punctual person I know.

entries.meaning: (chiefly mathematics) Existing as a point or series of points
(linguistics) Expressing momentary action that has no duration

examples: The management of the above mentioned feed sectors is subject to close co-operation with the Member States through  […]  punctual expert groups meetings where appropriate.
